message.content:
cs.LG, cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.AI

The paper proposes a novel method for fast uplink grant scheduling in machine type communications using the theory of multi-armed bandits. This involves modeling the problem as a sleeping MAB with stochastic availability and a stochastic reward function. The paper also proposes a probabilistic sleeping MAB algorithm and analyzes the regret. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning) as the paper proposes a learning algorithm based on MABs. Other likely sub-categories include cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) and cs.IT (Information Theory) as the paper deals with wireless communication systems and quality-of-service metrics. Additionally, cs.SY (Systems and Control) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are also possible sub-categories as the paper proposes a method for optimizing the scheduling of MTDs.
